pullRequest.body:
These are generally useful and split out of #5920.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: :v: tobiasgrosser can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6962139081/job/18945226989)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6962139081/job/18945226754)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6962139081/job/18945226453)
This is a non-terminal simp (more likely, one on each branch) so should be squeezed, or written a different way.
I am not sure which pattern had to be avoided, but I interpreted this as adding 'only' and dropping the *. Let me know what else you had in mind.

A "non-terminal `simp`" is a `simp` call that has no only *and* is not the last tactic in its goal. Two of your four simps in the revised version didn't need to be squeezed (via `only`), as they were terminal.

I pushed a small cleanup.
Impressive. I really need to code more lean. Thank you! The current reviewing experience is outstanding.

Usually in equalities arguments are explicit:
```suggestion
lemma and_two_pow (n i : ℕ) : n &&& 2 ^ i = (n.testBit i).toNat * 2 ^ i := by
```

Can you add `two_pow_and` for symmetry (with both `&&&` and `*` reversed)? You should prove it via commutativity, not by copying the proof.

bors d+

Thanks!
Added. If the CI goes through, I will push this PR.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add two power-of-two theorems to bitwise

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: replace Bitvec with Std.BitVec
